titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Henrietta Elizabeth Baldwin (Sperry) was a 1921 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. Prior to attending Bryn Mawr, she took preparatory classes at the Misses Kirk School in Bryn Mawr.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters from Henrietta Baldwin to her mother, Susan Baldwin, during her years at Bryn Mawr (1916 to 1921). Much of the correspondence concerns Baldwin's social activities: teas, "beaus," and shopping. Letters from 1918 describe the effects of the flu epidemic on the residents of Bryn Mawr. Other national and world events can also be traced through the letters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
